# MSCriticalMessagingError.notAuthorized

**Case**

The operation isn’t authorized.

## Declaration

```swift
case notAuthorized
```

## Discussion

The requested operation isn’t authorized; use [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSCriticalSMSMessenger/requestAuthorization(for:)] to request someone’s authorization to be able to send background messages from this app.

## Error codes

- **MSCriticalMessagingError.unknown**: The error code the framework returns after an unknown error occurs.
- **MSCriticalMessagingError.invalidAuthenticationRequest**: The authentication request isn’t valid.
- **MSCriticalMessagingError.notSupported**: The framework doesn’t support the current device.
- **MSCriticalMessagingError.sendFailed**: The message failed to send.
